Articles.Content:
So due to popular demand, here is a config that changes it to a kerbin-size solar system (real solar system but 1/10 scale). As before, other than Real Solar System, needs Planet Factory, Visual Enhancements, and Universe Replacer.

I have tried but failed to install the Kerbin-sized Solar System. I noticed that on the Universe Replacer map, it says [0.22] compability. Can that be the source of the problem or is there a specific order I need to install the mods in? Or did I miss something in connecting the mods?

Cheers so much in advance for any tip, I can't wait to play KSP with a real-ish world
Saturn is represented by Dres? Dres is supposed to be ceres. You should make your own gas giants (except jupiter of course).
So, what's the geosync orbit altitude for the mod?

yeah, forget going on a single roundtrip landing mission on jupiter and saturn

Not a big loss, I suppose, given they're both gas giants. Really, for those a round trip without landing would've been more useful.

So, what's the geosync orbit altitude for the mod?

The same as the real one - but your target should not be altitude, but to match your orbital period to the Earth one.
And how exactly would I do that? Can't you just give me the altitude?

Wikipedia is your friend Geostationary orbit

It says it is 35,786 km, but I think it is a bit different in RSS because we have a planet with a constant radius, unlike Earth. That should be pretty close though, make sure your orbital period is 23h 56m 4.1s

anyone know why this is happening?

It all returns to nothing...

since I started playing with this mod I really wanted to do a single launch, multi-crew mission to Mars. However the payload required for such a mission, even with kethane appeared to make it impossible. The ridiculousness of the launchers required for this stuff is stupendous.

Today it seems much more possible. I never thought I'd be able to launch 90 tons to LEO =D

Edited February 16, 2014 by maccollo

since I started playing with this mod I really wanted to do a single launch, multi-crew mission to Mars. However the payload required for such a mission, even with kethane appeared to make it impossible. The ridiculousness of the launchers required for this stuff is stupendous.

Today it seems much more possible. I never thought I'd be able to launch 90 tons to LEO =D

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/22015656/marsMission.jpg

Congratulations!

Next step.... Deadly Re-entry

(though, re-entry through Mars / Duna atmosphere is a little more forgiving than Earth/Kerbin. Except for the part where you get through re-entry and realize you're still going way too fast. Just thick enough to be a hazard. Not thick enough to slow you down...)

Congratulations!

Next step.... Deadly Re-entry

There are two inflatable heat shields included in that payload. One at the front and one at the back for aerodynamic stability

They are totally OP btw XD They weigh almost nothing and have insane drag. They basically function as drogue chutes for the drogue chutes.
By looking at your pictures I can only say you should try using the procedural parts! I am amazed to see someone using only stock in RSS

Here's a Mars sample return mission I just did. I forgot to take a screenshot of Mars entry, but I did use the inflatable heat shield as a drogue chute (along with a regular heat shield on the bottom).

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Impressive ship, maccollo, especially considering it's only stock parts.

since I started playing with this mod I really wanted to do a single launch, multi-crew mission to Mars. However the payload required for such a mission, even with kethane appeared to make it impossible. The ridiculousness of the launchers required for this stuff is stupendous.

Today it seems much more possible. I never thought I'd be able to launch 90 tons to LEO =D

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/22015656/marsMission.jpg

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/22015656/marsMissionLauncher.jpg

FYI, you could have done this long ago if you weren't so determined on launching a single craft. I built my Mars mission in four stages. Engines+Return Fuel, Transfer fuel which is later jettisoned, habitation, and finally crew. You went to an awful lot of trouble and made a really impossible rocket(impossible by real world standards) just to do something so unnecessarily difficult.

Edited February 16, 2014 by Razorcane

calkurne, that looks like your video card doesn't support 8192x4096 textures, maybe. Try reducing the size of EarthColor.png to 2048x1024 and see what happens.

maccollo: wow, that may be the largest stock launcher I've seen!

metaphor: bloody impressive, as always. I see you've now added RT2?

metaphor: bloody impressive, as always. I see you've now added RT2?

I did add RT2, but I disabled it halfway through this mission because it was really buggy, whenever I tried to switch vessels everything went white and there were doubled spacecraft after a restart.

Also, video of landing on Mars/Duna:

Edited February 16, 2014 by metaphor

Um, i found a small problem:

Prerelese v6 with planet factory config

Edited February 16, 2014 by JonSpace_CEO

FYI, you could have done this long ago if you weren't so determined on launching a single craft. I built my Mars mission in four stages. Engines+Return Fuel, Transfer fuel which is later jettisoned, habitation, and finally crew. You went to an awful lot of trouble and made a really impossible rocket(impossible by real world standards) just to do something so unnecessarily difficult.

That, to me, is the whole point of RSS. Allowing myself multiple launches would replace the challenge with tedium.

Altho initially I was actually planning to do 2 launches for my mars mission.I found that acceptable because even the most bare bone mission designs use at least that many. But then I managed to create my super huge launcher and figured that I might aswell do it in one, because the less the better

And now I have to complete this mission before 0.24, when my accomplishment will be nullified =P

Edited February 16, 2014 by maccollo

Um, i found a small problem:

Prerelese v6 with planet factory config

I don't know if that bug has anything to do with planet factory, but the config is for v5.5 and is probably not going to work otherwise. So if you use the v6 prerelease don't use the config. I'm going to update it when v6 hits the front page.

calkurne, that looks like your video card doesn't support 8192x4096 textures, maybe. Try reducing the size of EarthColor.png to 2048x1024 and see what happens.

I remember having this issue when I first launched RSS v6 in combination with visual enhancements (clouds / city lights) or something.

Been some time, can't remember fully, but I'm nearly certain my video card wasn't the issue when I got the red planet issue, more than likely a weird combination of visual enhancement config and/or planet config + RSS config for krag's planet factory.

Took some tinkering but finally got Xichang Satellite Launch Center configured (although I am pretty sure the altitude is wrong) still amazing work Nathan. <iframe class="imgur-album" width="100%" height="550" frameborder="0" src="http://imgur.com/a/DiSz7/embed"></iframe>

can't seem to figure out how to post a imgur film strip (help )

PQSCity

					KEYname = KSC

					lodvisibleRangeMult = 6

				}
				PQSMod_MapDecalTangent

					//radius = 79637.5

					heightMapDeformity = 0 // was 75
					absoluteOffset = 0
					absolute = true
					latitude = 28.246017
					longitude = 102.026556

Edited February 18, 2014 by chandawg
I ren ito a isuss of the earth textrur not loading, the ksp being underground, and kerben moved way out to the outer system
does the version 6 need planet factory?

Did you, like I told you, delete the RSS folder and then download v6pre fresh and install that?

No it does not need PF. I would say so in the OP if it did.

I went on better Nathan I deleted all my mods. uninstalled ksp deleted the ksp folder re downloaded form steam, then tryed it with just the RSS 6 to see if I had the same problem... I wondering if my down load might have gotten corrupted some how... wish I had saved my out put log though maybe that might give some one with more programing smarts then me, some clue to what was going on
